content.body: Okay so based on discussion in the slide, maybe "the when" and "the if", then the LHS can be "the matcher" and `default` can be a "default matcher".

content.body: I've been pretty lukewarm about the term `matcher` but I think given the discussion in the slide it makes sense

content.body: using "matcher" to just refer to the 'when' part didn't quite pull its weight, i agree, but I think it's worthwhile as a replacement for "the LHS of a match clause"
